author: Special Correspondent
text:
Chief Electoral Officer V. Candavelou on Monday warned of stringent action against ‘small newspapers’ and tabloids if they carry any paid news.

In a press release, Dr. Candavelou said the Election Commission of India (ECI) has directed that the District Level Media Certificate Committee and the State Level Media Certificate and Monitoring Committee shall scan ‘small-level newspapers’ and tabloids also for any suspected cases of paid news or news under the guise of advertisements. “If any such cases are found, it will be considered as violation of Section 127A(1) of the Representation of the People Act and appropriate legal action as per the provisions of Section 127(A)(4) of the Act will be initiated against the publisher of the newspaper/ tabloid,” said Dr. Candavelou. He also directed the publishers to act diligently when publishing news items or advertisements.

title: CEO warns of stringent action against paid news
